It has been attracting dedicated individuals for more than eight years who are inspired every day to break down barriers to international education and take their careers to new heights at a company that will invest in their career growth. Our six core valuesare our compass in our mission to Educate the World and the foundation of our unique company culture. The Opportuinity:

What you will do everyday:


  • Represent ApplyBoard brand to promote ApplyBoard services to agents, international educators, and prospective students

title: Research Associate, Education project, Tutoring, Morocco Employment Lab, Morocco - J-PAL MENA
description:
Research Associate, Education project, Tutoring, Morocco Employment Lab, Morocco - J-PAL MENA



Organization: Location:
Morocco
Start Date (Earliest): 1 October 2023 Start Date (Latest): 1 November 2023 Length of Commitment: One year The Morocco Employment Lab (MEL) is looking to hire a Research Associate to coordinate its research efforts to foster a culture of evidence-based policymaking in Morocco, conducted by a team of international researchers. This position will be based in our offices at the University Mohammed VI Polytechnic campus in Rabat.

About the Morocco Employment Lab (MEL)



Launched in September 2020 as part of a joint partnership between the Abdul Latif Jameel Poverty Action Lab (J-PAL) and Center for International Development (CID), the Morocco Employment Lab (MEL) seeks to create a culture of evidence-based policymaking in Morocco through rigorous impact evaluations and capacity building.
MEL partners with key stakeholders in the labor and education sectors to help improve their policies and programs. Labor sector projects cover topics such as youth economic inclusion, job search assistance and intermediation and vocational training. Projects on education range from early childhood education to foundational literacy and teacher professional development. MEL aims to develop new research projects in additional sectors in the near future, such as health and social protection sectors.
MEL works across four complementary components to contribute to building a culture of evidence-based policy and ensuring that public policies and programs are informed by evidence:
-

Identify policy priorities


: The Morocco Employment Lab works with policymakers to diagnose key policy challenges, especially those compounded by COVID-19, identify data, highlight and prioritize knowledge gaps.
-

Build capacity for evidence use


: The Morocco Employment Lab hosts training workshops and events on how to generate and use evidence in policymaking. Tailored trainings are being delivered to researchers, civil service trainees, NGOs and government officials at different levels to create a broad understanding of how evidence can be used in policy and program design.
-

Conduct impact evaluations


: Together with its policy partners, the Morocco Employment Lab co-designs and implements a portfolio of impact evaluations that address the identified policy priority issues.
-

Share evidence to inform policy


: The Morocco Employment Lab disseminates research results to a wide range of stakeholders through large-scale policy symposiums, policy briefs, and online communication channels.

About the research project



This research project is a randomized evaluation conducted by J-PAL affiliated and other international researchers: Andreas de Barros (University of California Irvine), Marc Gurgand (Paris School of Economics), Rebecca Thornton (Baylor University), Hosam Ibrahim (University of Minnesota), Sarah Chloe Deschenes (The World Bank).
The subject of the evaluation is an intervention implemented by the Ministry of National Education, Preschool and Sports (MENPS) of Morocco that seeks to place students from teacher training programs as tutors in middle schools. The objective is to study how employing these teacher trainees as tutors to address weak fundamental skills can impact student learning and skills, as well as the effect of placing teacher trainees on teacher selection and future quality.

About the position



The position offers an opportunity to gain first-hand experience in the design and implementation of impact evaluations as well as data collection, management, and analysis, in an organization undertaking cutting-edge development research.
Research Associates work closely with academic researchers and other field staff to perform a variety of tasks including, but not limited to: designing survey questionnaires, conducting qualitative research, running pilot tests, refining the design and the survey instruments of the study, managing survey teams, negotiating contracts with survey firms, checking and analyzing data, cleaning data and assisting in the preliminary analysis, assisting in the writing of project reports and policy memos, and coordinating with the local partner running the program under evaluation.
The position is designed to help the selected candidate prepare for graduate-level studies in economics, quantitative education research, and/or further professional opportunities in impact evaluation. Alumni who worked with the study's investigators in similar positions have gone on to Ph.D. and Masters programs at Harvard and the University of Chicago, for example.
This position is based in Rabat, Morocco.

Key Responsibilities

title: Co-Founder / Farm Operations Manager
description:
About WASIT:

At WASIT, we're on a mission to revolutionize sustainable agriculture investment and empower small farmers. We've building a unique platform that allows regular individuals to invest in agriculture without owning the physical assets, all while contributing to food security and positive impact.


WASIT is in the ideation phase, and our goal is to deliver the first Minimum Viable Product (MVP) that will enable us to secure funding. Equity sharing in the company will be offered as part of the co-founding team.


Role Overview:

We are seeking a passionate and driven individual to join us as a Co-Founder/Operations Manager. This key role will be based in Morocco and will play a pivotal role in building and managing relationships with our partner farmers, ensuring the success and sustainability of our agricultural investments.


Responsibilities:

  • Farmers' Liaison: Act as the primary point of contact with our partner farmers in Morocco. Build strong relationships, provide support, and ensure adherence to sustainable farming practices.
  • Operational Excellence: Oversee day-to-day operations related to agriculture investments, including crop management, logistics, and quality control.
  • Expansion Strategy: Collaborate with the founding team to expand our agricultural assets into new regions within Morocco and potentially other African countries.
  • Team Leadership: Build and lead a local operations team to execute our agricultural strategies effectively.


Why Join WASIT:

  • Be part of an innovative startup that's making a positive impact on agriculture and Moroccan communities.
  • Play a vital role in shaping the future of sustainable investments.
  • Opportunity to grow internationally.



Skills

  • Willingness to embrace challenges, learn from failures, and continuously improve.
  • Knowledge of farming practices, ideally with proven track record in agricultural operations.
  • Entrepreneurial mindset and a passion for sustainable agriculture and impact investing.
  • Excellent communication and relationship-building skills.
  • Fluency in Arabic and proficiency in English is a plus.
  • Willingness to be a co-founder and share in the vision of building a sustainable agriculture platform.

UNHCR Manual/Programme Chapter, Operations Plans, UN and UNHCR financial/budgetary rules and regulations will guide the work of the Senior Programme Associate. title: Content and Technology Coordinator
description:
By some estimates, consumers in Africa spend relatively up to ten times more of their disposable income on food compared to developed markets. On the other hand, smallholder farmers in fresh produce supply chains encounter multiple challenges that prevent them from achieving sustainable livelihoods through their farms. This economic challenge to food security is primarily caused by the highly fragmented and inefficient retail market across the continent, where roughly 90% consists of small independent retailers.


YoLa Fresh is aiming to be Africa's largest fresh produce supply chain, which leverages technology and data to organize the agriculture commerce ecosystem. Our technology and Africa-centric solutions will disrupt the way fruits and vegetables move from farms to consumers‚Äô plates. We empower farmers and other players in the ecosystem in ways never done before. Our Supply Chain is equipped to move thousands tonnes of perishables from farms to businesses, every day, in less than 24 hours.


YoLa Fresh has been founded by repeat Founders from leading technology unicorns (Jumia, Careem, NinjaCart, Avito, etc.). Alongside them, YoLa Fresh got a stellar set of investors (African and International VCs) & advisors (executives from blue chip companies).


We are a highly motivated, results driven community, who focus on proactive approaches to problem solving. We cherish entrepreneurial spirit and provide significant operating autonomy to senior leaders. There are ample opportunities and challenges to be solved at scale and in real-time.¬†


Are you passionate about tech solutions and fostering collaborative relationships? We are seeking a Tech Operations Manager to play a pivotal role in managing our relationship with our SaaS tech provider. You will be responsible for ensuring seamless integration, implementation, and optimization of technology to fit our processes. Your role will involve providing tech support to internal teams, leading the implementation of new features, and driving various IT projects, all while adopting a user-centric mindset.   • Minimum of 2 years of experience in a tech-related role; tech vendor management experience preferred.

  • Solid understanding of SaaS solutions and ERP systems.

  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey technical information to non-technical stakeholders.

  • Strong project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.

  • Detail-oriented with strong organizational and time-management skills.

  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and project management tools.

  • Fluency in English and Arabic or French.

title: External Supply Quality Assurance Manager
description:
Job Description



Job Purpose
Responsible for managing quality aspects at external suppliers for Biopharmaceuticals / Pharmaceutical / Devices and to ensure that the operational business is in compliance with cGMP, the Quality Assurance Agreement, regulatory requirements and the Novartis Pharma Quality Manual and is conducted according to the relevant SOPs.
Major Accountabilities
Lead External Suppliers Qualification process. Acts as Single Point of Contact / SPOC for all quality related activities at the External Supplier Ensure that all aspects of the handling, manufacturing and distribution of biopharmaceutical / pharmaceutical products are in compliance with the Novartis Pharma Quality Manual, the effective Quality Agreement that they meet relevant cGMP regulatory requirements and are conducted according to local SOPs. Responsible for driving / initiating External Supplier Quality Risk assessments to be carried out for all External Suppliers. Gaps are Quality Systems to be identified with an evaluation of the associated risks. Remediation plans are to be defined and execution is to be monitored to ensure that issues are suitably addressed Provide the quality presence and in-put to Technical meetings with the External suppliers and establish good working relationships with clear communication and defined actions and goals. Ensure that a valid QA agreement defined in line with the requirements of the Global template is in place which clearly defines cGMP roles and responsibilities between Novartis and the External Supplier, as well as Product details and requirements. Approve Quality Agreement on behalf of the QA Lead. Request, review and process GMP documentation as defined by the Quality Agreement and Novartis SOPs. Manage the quality aspects of the relationship in accordance with the effective Quality Agreement. Perform the required periodic review and make recommendations for amendments to the agreement based on identified needs and issues. Responsible for coordinating and ensuring that Quality auditing of External suppliers is carried out according to the Novartis Quality Manual - maintain an annual auditing program, participate in and/or lead audits, manage action plans and follow up on agreed upon CAPAs. Ensure site readiness for regulatory inspections at External suppliers where appropriate. Manage/Approve critical quality issues (deviations, complaints, recalls, counterfeits and product tampering, stability failures, etc) according to the Quality Agreement and the Novartis Quality Manual. Ensure investigations are correctly executed. Ensure all required actions are taken appropriately and in a timely fashion. Escalate any issues or instances of instability per the Novartis escalation policy, and initiate any market action that is required. Decide escalation to Senior Management Level and lead Global Quality Assessments and manage filing (FAR/BPDR) accordingly. Support / participate in Novartis Emergency Management cases as required. Ensure that Change requests, either from the External Supplier or from Novartis, are managed according to the Quality Agreement and Novartis SOPs from receipt, through to the implementation and closure. Responsible for assessing quality trends and driving continuous improvement for processes and product quality performance.
Is the Quality representative on the Quality/Business Management Meetings for External Supply, and ensures robust review and escalation of critical quality issues arising within the area of responsibility. Stability reports and PQR‚Äôs, Ensure that the External Supplier provides the required product review or the data as specified in the relevant Quality Agreement on an annual basis. Critically assess the performance of the product and process and provide the assessment to the report annually. Approve PQR‚Äôs on behalf of the QA Lead. Support due diligence activities and provide External Supply QA recommendation (auditing, technical and quality assessments). Act as Key QA contact for ESO Sourcing/Strategy (and/or Business Development & Licensing) for the technologies in use in his QA organization Support launches of product in close collaboration with BD& L partner and/ or development organization. Support transfer of products in close collaboration with ESO MS&T and with QA from donor site. Ensure External Supplier readiness for commercial manufacturing starting from validation activities. .
Assess and ensure External Supplier readiness for HA inspections (PAI, directed, other).
Within the organization
Implement and maintain a local Quality System and Standard Operating Procedures defining all the processes for managing of External suppliers. This role combines data analysis and client consultation from the start, with plenty of room for growth. You find the stories behind scatter plots and help clients determine which products to launch. Your insights will influence decisions for some of today‚Äôs leading global companies.

NIQ is the world‚Äôs leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. Views stretch across the olive groves and palms of the oasis, extending to the High Atlas Mountains on the horizon.

POSITION OVERVIEW



The General Manager of Amanjena holds responsibility for the entire hotel operation.
Reporting to Regional Managing Director of EMEA, the General Manager leads the team to operational excellence and delivers exceptional guest experiences, through ensuring colleagues are well informed and engaged, whilst focusing on revenues and maximising financial performance. In line with our Value of Celebrating Communities, it is paramount that the General Manager is an active part of the local community.

RESPONSIBILITIES



Key duties of General Manager include:
Develops an operational strategy that is aligned with the Aman‚Äôs business strategy and leads its execution. Works with team to put sustainable work processes and systems in place that support the execution of the strategy. Keeps operations teams focused on the critical components of operations to drive guest satisfaction and the desired financial results; makes and executes key decisions to keep property moving forward towards achievement of goals. Champions the Aman‚Äôs service vision for product and service delivery and ensures alignment amongst the property Leadership team. Is highly visible and interfaces with guests on a regular basis to obtain feedback on quality of product, service levels and overall satisfaction. Creates appropriate development plans and develops colleagues based on their individual strengths, development needs, career aspirations and abilities. Ensures the same is done for all managers in the property. Suggests innovative marketing ideas to gain market share. Ensures operations team has a sales strategy with aggressive goals and motivates individuals to achieve these goals and maximize performance. Working closely with corporate team to deliver future residence project on the property

QUALIFICATIONS



We are looking for a visionary leader with a strong background in managing luxury resorts. Experience with working in remote location is preferred.
The successful candidate will be a charismatic ambassador for the property, setting the highest standards of personal presentation and must be able to uphold the reputation of the property through a quality-driven, guest-focussed approach.
You will be a strong operational, highly-organised leader who is visible in the business and enjoys interacting with guests. In addition, you will be skilled at building relationships with stakeholders.
In addition to a deep understanding of luxury, the successful candidate will be a strategic thinker, adept at identifying growth opportunities and fostering innovation. You will possess strong business acumen to ensure top and bottom-line performance and act with integrity.
We are looking for a dynamic, approachable leader who leads by example, inspiring colleagues and fostering a culture of excellence. You will be passionate about colleague engagement and make team development a priority.
You will have a bachelor‚Äôs degree in hospitality or other relevant discipline and be fluent in English (additional languages are an advantage).
You will have a proven track record as a leader in ultra-luxury hospitality operation in and have demonstrated success in leading teams and working with external stakeholders.
Previous experience with managing hospitality operation with luxury residence is beneficial
French speaker required.

About the Benefits



Aman Resorts offer wonderful benefits including exciting international career growth in a company that is expanding rapidly.
If you're ready to take on the challenge of shaping the future of this unique property and creating unforgettable guest experiences, we invite you to join our team.

title: Sales Development Representative ll
description:
Job Description:


As a Sales Development Representative at Pipeline Gurus, you will be responsible for generating and qualifying leads, identifying potential clients, and setting up initial meetings for our Business Development Managers. Your role is critical in driving our sales pipeline and ensuring a steady flow of opportunities for our clients.


Key Responsibilities:


  1. Lead Generation: Research and identify potential startup clients in the SaaS and AI sectors, particularly those targeting B2B enterprises and government agencies.
  2. Outreach: Execute outbound prospecting campaigns through phone calls, email, and LinkedIn to initiate conversations with potential clients.
  3. Qualification: Qualify leads by understanding their needs, pain points, and suitability for our services. Assess their level of interest and readiness to engage with our Business Development Managers.
  4. Appointment Setting: Schedule meetings and appointments for our Business Development Managers with qualified leads. Ensure accurate and timely communication with both clients and internal team members.
  5. Data Management: Maintain accurate records of lead interactions and status updates in our CRM system. Continuously update and refine lead information.

Who We Are



Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we work closely with clients to embrace a transformational approach aimed at benefiting all stakeholders‚Äîempowering organizations to grow, build sustainable competitive advantage, and drive positive societal impact.

What You'll Do



As a part of BCG X you will work closely with consulting teams on a diverse range of advanced topics. You will have the opportunity to leverage software development methodologies to deliver value to BCG's Consulting & BCG X (case) teams, BCG X Product teams and Practice Areas (domain) through providing software developer subject matter expertise, and accelerated execution support. You will collaborate with teams to gather requirements, specify, design, develop, deliver and support software solutions serving client needs. You will provide technical support through deeper understanding of relevant software solutions and processes to build high quality and efficient technology solutions. Assignments will range from short term Proof of concepts/Minimum viable product to long term cases with enterprise grade software development as a critical enabler through the project level description of the role responsibilities and impact within the organization.
As a UX/ UI Designer you will be part of the founding design team within the newly created Design Chapter, reporting to Chapter Lead. You will work towards establishing a customer-centric design culture and developing a fit-for purpose self-service data product as the company moves to become a product centric organisation.
Responsibilities:
‚Ä¢ Demonstrate solid understanding of common visual and interaction design principles and practice, and create appropriate sketches, wireframes, flows, design comps, and prototypes with guidance. ‚Ä¢ Value and apply existing customer insights from research to guide design decisions as well as initiating and supporting research efforts with research partners ‚Ä¢ Frame problems and opportunities clearly through analysis of qualitative and quantitative inputs, and customer and stakeholder perspectives ‚Ä¢ Propose creative communicative visualizations to streamline research messages to teams and stakeholders (eg. User journeys, personae, systemic maps) ‚Ä¢ Triangulate stakeholder vision, user insights, and team discussion inputs, and integrate insights into design proposition. ‚Ä¢ Propose creative interactive experiences based on outputs of research and ideation activities. ‚Ä¢ Master the phases of design from initial sketching to wireframing and high-fidelity prototyping. ‚Ä¢ Demonstrate experience in facilitating ideation sessions with stakeholders and cross-functional teams. ‚Ä¢ Use design system effectively and appropriately and understand differences and similarities between design systems/platforms ‚Ä¢ Demonstrate experience in testing and iterating on physical and digital designs, both with stakeholders and with users. ‚Ä¢ Create routine, informative communication materials explaining design decision-making rationale to team members and stakeholders. ‚Ä¢ Partner with product managers, engineers, and content designers to solve for customer problems leveraging an agile way of working ‚Ä¢ Understand and incorporate feasibility, viability and strategic stakeholder constraints into the design. ‚Ä¢ Collect, process and act on design feedback constructively ‚Ä¢ Use design, ideation, testing and other tools effectively (eg figma, miro, dovetail, testing tools)

What You'll Bring (Experience & Qualifications)



Qualifications :
‚Ä¢ You have strong UX design experience on B2B and B2C products and experiences. ‚Ä¢ You have experience with UX Strategy, UX Research, UX Design and UI Design ‚Ä¢ You've worked with a variety of tools; you'll be able to recommend and use what you think is best e.g. Figma, Adobe suite and others ‚Ä¢ You have a wealth of experience creating design wireframes, prototypes, and mock-ups for developers to convert to code ‚Ä¢ You have design thinking experience to discover problems and come up with creative solutions by thoroughly understanding users' goals, frustrations, and end-task ‚Ä¢ You're collaborative and pragmatic with excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, happy to mentor and develop others ‚Ä¢ Bachelor's degree or equivalent in; Visual Design, Human-Computer Interaction, User Experience, or related Design field. ‚Ä¢ You have an entrepreneurial mindset, and you are ready to dive into different types of user and stakeholder problems.

title: Service Delivery Manager
description:
MEGA is a SaaS software company, headquartered in Paris, France, with offices in 10 countries and clients worldwide. We are leaders in the domains of Enterprise Architecture and GRC (Governance Risk and Compliance).
Our goal is to support business transformation. We believe that transformation is a collaborative effort, so we created a single SaaS platform that connects IT leaders, process owners, risk managers and data governance officers. As transformation is a complex effort, we give them access to a single repository that helps them plan and adapt to change.
We are a team of 350 multi-cultural and dynamic professionals, who create, sell and implement software for the largest companies. Our clients include large banks, insurance companies, public administration, airspace, energy, and many more.
Our software platform, HOPEX, is recognized as a clear leader in its field. We invest year on year on new technology and innovation to keep our competitive lead.
We also believe that a company‚Äôs success is based on its people, so we make it a priority to hire the best and help our employees evolve within the company, throughout departments and offices.
The MEGA Global Services Department is hiring a Service Delivery Manager to join the team in our Casablanca‚Äôs offices, MEGA NAF.

*

Your Role as a Service Delivery Manager



As a Service Delivery Manager, you report directly to the Mega Cloud Services (MCS) Director and you will be our customer advocate at MEGA.
You have a 360¬∞ view of the customers you manage and engage MEGA in front of them.
As SDM you are accountable for maintain good customer relationships and improve the company's services to keep customer satisfaction.
You‚Äôll need to ensure SLAs compliance and a follow up on issues resolution status.

Implementation



Lead scoping and monthly meetings with customers Drive the implementation of ITSM process management Coordinate customers' operational acceptance

Operation



Plan maintenance tasks with client (and cloud engineer) Track service performance against the SLA Plan upgrades or new configurations with the client's administrator Plan exceptional operations with the customer Manage severe incidents and crises related to SLA non-compliance

Governance



Create performance reports Prepare service disruption reports

Follow-up



Organize and/or participate to client steering committees Communicate and manage the customer relationship regarding SaaS deployment and utilisation.
You have 10 years' experience overall, including at least 3 years in customer relations and/or negotiation, ideally in a SaaS context. Previous project management/consulting experience expected. Fluent spoken and written in French and English. In your daily practice, you are proactive and organized, you ensure a rigorous follow-up with regular reporting and raise the appropriate alerts. You have good management and social skills and a great sense of confidentiality. Service oriented and customer satisfaction focused are essential qualities for this position.
As an international leader in our market, we develop software to support companies in their continuous, agile and responsible digital transformation for the benefit of their own customers and employees.We pay particular attention to personal development, continuous learning, well-being at work and the quality of relations between our employees.
By joining us you will have

title: Legal Consultant, CRVS Program, Morocco
description:
Share

Legal Consultant, CRVS Program, Morocco



Consultant 15 days ago Requisition ID: 1006 The Global Health Advocacy Incubator (GHAI) supports civil society organizations advocating for public health policies that reduce death and disease. We bring a proven advocacy approach and a global network of local partners, built on a 25-year track record of success across multiple issues in more than 60 countries. GHAI is an initiative of the Campaign for Tobacco-Free Kids.

Consultancy with an estimated start date of September 1, 2023About the Data for Health Program:



GHAI is part of the Bloomberg Philanthropies Data for Health (D4H) Initiative, which supports low- and middle-income countries in Africa, Latin America, and Asia and the Pacific to improve civil registration and vital statistics (CRVS) systems. Civil registration systems are the systems that register births, deaths, fetal deaths, and other vital events. Civil registration data is used to produce vital statistics, which are essential for government planning and policymaking; and birth and death registration create and retire an individual‚Äôs legal identity.

Under the D4H Initiative, GHAI provides technical assistance to help countries strengthen their CRVSID systems through (1) legal reviews and reforms and (2) budget advocacy for increased and sustainable funding of these systems. D4H partner organizations are currently running projects in Morocco and the government has requested assistance with undertaking a legal review of the CRVSID system with a view to amending the legal framework in line with best practice.



About the position:
GHAI seeks an in-country legal consultant to support a review and reform of the CRVS legal framework in Morocco. This involves an analysis of the CRVS laws and system to identify gaps, bottlenecks and obstacles to a well-functioning and integrated CRVSID system and recommend how the relevant legal instruments (laws, regulations, guidelines, SOPs, etc.) can be reformed, amended or created anew to better align with international best practices. The consultant will then work with and assist government officials in taking the legal reform process forward, according to the priorities of the government, including providing technical assistance in drafting relevant legal instruments where required.
The consultant will work in close coordination with government officials and D4H partner organizations as part of a broader program to improve CRVS systems in Morocco.
Training on the CRVS best practice and legal review process will be provided to the consultant.

Duration and basis of consultancy



The consultancy will initially be a full-time position for 12 months from approximately 1 September 2023 to 31 August 2024.
Additional work may be agreed upon after the initial consultancy period, depending on the stage at which the legal review and reform project has reached and upon agreement with the Moroccan government and D4H partner organization as to the further work required.
This position is based in Morocco.

WHAT YOU'LL ACCOMPLISH:



+ Attend CRVS Best Practices Training (offered by GHAI);
+ Gather all relevant CRVS legal documents (laws, regulations, decrees, guidelines, standard operating procedures, circulars, manuals, etc.);
+ Attend and participate in the CRVS Legal Review Launch Workshop and assist with preparations and presentations as necessary;
+ Request missing information through informational interviews with key CRVS stakeholders;
+ Undertake a comprehensive and complete analysis of Morocco‚Äôs legal framework applying global best practice and using those chapters of the Data for Health CRVS Legal and Regulatory Review Toolkit that have been selected by the relevant government agencies;
+ Draft a Recommendations Report based on the findings from the Toolkit analysis, and make the revisions and edits requested by GHAI and the stakeholders until the report is finalized;
+ Present the Recommendation Report at a second workshop;
+ Revise the Recommendation Report based on Stakeholder and GHAI feedback;
+ Regularly communicate with and update the relevant national stakeholders involved in CRVS to ensure they remain involved with, and informed about, the project‚Äôs outputs;
+ Apply a strong working knowledge of the Morocco political and administrative systems, processes and players to identify opportunities to advocate for changes and prioritization of CRVS legal reforms;
+ Build and maintain relations with key governmental officials and political leaders to achieve CRVS legal reform;
+ Provide technical assistance with drafting laws, regulations, SOPs and guidelines, as required, to ensure the legal reforms are comprehensive and in line with best practices;
+ Prepare detailed monthly, quarterly and other reports on progress as requested.
+ Communicate progress with GHAI staff as required and coordinate closely with the Bloomberg D4H Health Initiative partner organizations.

SKILLS YOU'LL BRING TO THE ROLE:



+ A law degree from a law school accredited by the national authority. Advanced degree in public health, public policy, health financing or other relevant field highly desirable.
+ Five to ten years of relevant legal experience (practicing or teaching) preferably including in relation to public health or broader public sector issues.
+ A strong understanding of Morocco‚Äôs legal system, including how laws, regulations and other legal documents are developed, drafted, and adopted.
+ Strong understanding of the constitutional structure, administrative systems, and policy-making procedures in Morocco.
+ Knowledge of and experience in using legal analysis to advance policy change objectives.
+ A background in human rights, civil rights, public affairs, or regulatory affairs preferred.
+ Excellent analytical skills, legal writing and research ability.
+ Experience in legal analysis of public health or public policy issues.
+ Ability to communicate and work closely with government stakeholders, local and global partners.
+ Ability to take initiative and work independently with general supervision and oversight.
+ Ability to travel domestically and internationally.
+ Some knowledge of civil registration, vital statistics and/or identity management (CRVS) is desirable, however, experience in CRVS is not required; training will be provided
+ English language proficiency is highly desirable but not essential.
+

We believe our programs are strengthened when they are developed and supported by individuals with diverse life experiences, whose understanding of social and cultural issues can help make The Campaign's work more inclusive. We encourage qualified applicants of all ages, racial, economic, social, cultural, sexual orientation, ability and gender expressions, national origins, and veteran statuses to apply. The Global Health Advocacy Incubator (GHAI) supports civil society organizations advocating for public health policies that reduce death and disease. title: Logistic Engineer
description:
Howmet Fixations Casablanca is looking for Logistic Engineer (Sales Administration)


The Logistic Engineer is responsible for the organization, management and follow-up of purchase orders and the proper handling of orders. He/she is also responsible for ensuring that the time limit for sending acknowledgements of receipt is respected.


Key Activities:


  • registering orders in the ERP system and notifying the relevant departments via the contract review process. He/she is also responsible for communicating with the customer on the progress of the order. To do this, he is responsible for issuing acknowledgements of receipt and preparation slips,
  • managing sales contracts. These may be contracts with customers or service providers.
  • Inform his/her hierarchy of information related to sales via performance indicators. To do this, he/she creates monitoring dashboards.
  • facilitating relations between the various internal departments (purchasing, finance, IT, methods and quality, etc.) in order to guarantee the smooth running of sales.
  • managing the daily relations with the customers, either by making contact through different channels or by organizing meetings/calls.

In fact, it acts as an intermediary and works closely with all the company's departments. This makes it possible to establish and maintain a link between the various divisions.


His function leads to answer calls for tender, to manage the quotations with the management and to negotiate the conditions of sale with the customers so that it proceeds as well as possible. He is also responsible for implementing sales procedures.


In addition, throughout all stages of the sale, he/she ensures that quality and compliance standards are respected. It is also the role of the sales administration to handle and resolve possible disputes with customers as well. These can be multiple and linked to delivery delays, defective products or wrong quantities. In all cases, he must be able to find an adequate solution to guarantee customer satisfaction.


As part of the site logistics team, the Logistic Engineer can also manage¬†scheduling and work orders follow-up tasks.

‚Ä¢ Work with technology and data and gain broad exposure to a range of industries, including financial services, retail, restaurants, hospitality and more.

‚Ä¢ Grow by receiving hands-on mentorship from an experienced management team.
‚Ä¢ Have an opportunity for meaningful contributions.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with colleagues across different areas of the organization and gain exposure to business development, account management, and product management.
We are looking for passionate and talented professionals, who share our vision for helping our clients with their most urgent business need. We are recruiting for 4 career tracks that make up our team:
1- Strategy & Transformation:
Lead clients through sound decision making as they tackle strategic, tactical, operational, and transformational challenges, spanning across diverse topics including product, marketing, loyalty, innovation, and more. Apply a broad set of problem-solving techniques to improve overall performance and operations.
Sampling of questions we help our clients answer:

title: Senior Research Associate, Morocco Employment Lab - J-PAL MENA
description:
Senior Research Associate, Morocco Employment Lab - J-PAL MENA



Organization: Location:
Morocco
Start Date (Earliest): 1 November 2023 Start Date (Latest): 15 November 2023 Length of Commitment: Less than one year

I- Job summary



The Morocco Employment Lab (MEL) is looking to hire a Senior Research Associate to coordinate its research efforts to foster a culture of evidence-based policymaking in Morocco. This position will be based in our offices at the University Mohammed VI Polytechnic campus in Rabat.About the Morocco Employment Lab (MEL)Launched in September 2020 as part of a joint partnership between the Abdul Latif Jameel Poverty Action Lab (J-PAL) and Center for International Development (CID), the Morocco Employment Lab (MEL) seeks to create a culture of evidence-based policymaking in Morocco through rigorous impact evaluations and capacity building.MEL partners with key stakeholders in the labor and education sectors to help improve their policies and programs. Labor sector projects cover topics such as youth economic inclusion, job search assistance and intermediation and vocational training. Projects on education range from early childhood education to foundational literacy and teacher professional development. MEL aims to develop new research projects in additional sectors in the near future, such as health and social protection sectors.
MEL works across four complementary components to contribute to building a culture of evidence-based policy and ensuring that public policies and programs are informed by evidence:
Identify policy priorities: The Morocco Employment Lab works with policymakers to diagnose key policy challenges, especially those compounded by COVID-19, identify data, highlight and prioritize knowledge gaps.
Build capacity for evidence use: The Morocco Employment Lab hosts training workshops and events on how to generate and use evidence in policymaking. Tailored trainings are being delivered to researchers, civil service trainees, NGOs and government officials at different levels to create a broad understanding of how evidence can be used in policy and program design.
Conduct impact evaluations: Together with its policy partners, the Morocco Employment Lab co-designs and implements a portfolio of impact evaluations that address the identified policy priority issues.
Share evidence to inform policy: The Morocco Employment Lab disseminates research results to a wide range of stakeholders through large-scale policy symposiums, policy briefs, and online communication channels.
About the Senior Research Associate role
The position offers a unique opportunity for the Senior Research Associate to develop and support the research infrastructure of the Morocco Employment Lab and assist a variety of research projects in the areas of data security, data analysis, and field support in an organization undertaking cutting-edge development research. The Morocco Employment Lab scientific directors are Bruno Cr√©pon (ENSAE), Rema Hanna (Harvard) and Florencia Devoto (MEL).The Senior Research Associate will be directly supervised by the Morocco Employment Lab Director, and will also work closely with senior staff from J-PAL MENA and CID, academic researchers and other field staff to perform a variety of research tasks.

II. Key responsibilities:



Research project management:
Collaborate with researchers on the design and implementation of data collection plans Oversee field research activities, including the implementation of the evaluation, according to the research design in coordination with researchers and partners Assist with hiring survey firms, including drafting terms of reference Maintain and grow effective relationships with partner organizations Play an active role in researchers and research associate‚Äôs onboarding Collaborate with research staff throughout the project lifecycle. This includes supporting with technical questions (e.g. coding in STATA), devising data encryption protocols, personally identifiable data management‚Ä¶etc. Ensure J-PAL research protocols are respected through all research activities, report to J-PAL Global and J-PAL MENA Lead local institutional review board applications Engage with local authorities and undertake administrative procedures to ensure all data collection authorizations are obtained Develop research public projects, under the supervision of J-PAL Global and J-PAL MENA research teams
Reporting and Communication:
Provide periodic updates on project activities to researchers and subject experts Participate in the planning and design of any activities with partners Ensure that project activities are on schedule and prepare project update reports according to agreements with funders and partners Any other work assigned by the MEL‚Äôs Directors

III. Requirements



Education:
A Master's Degree in economics, public policy, mathematics, statistics or related technical fields including training in microeconomics, econometrics, statistics, and advanced mathematics Graduate-level coursework in economics is a plus
Experience:
Minimum 3 years of relevant experience, including 2 years of research experienceExperience with STATA and/or R data analysis software is a must; experience interpreting data analysis; experience with academic writing Experience with budget management is a plus Experience with living in Morocco is a strong advantage Skills:Very strong quantitative, organisational, and communication skills are necessary Fluency in French and in English. Arabic command is a strong advantage Flexible, self-motivating, able to manage multiple tasks efficiently, and a team player Demonstrated ability to manage high-level relationships with partner organisations Familiarity with evaluation methods and randomized controlled trials preferred Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines

How to Apply



If you are interested, please share your CV and cover letter with Jamila Ayoub at jayoub@povertyactionlab.org following these instructions: (1) In the subject line: Include your full name: first (given) name followed by last (family) name, followed by job title: ‚ÄúSenior Research Associate, Employment Lab, Morocco‚Äù.Given the volume of applications received, only short-listed candidates will be contacted for an interview.

title: HR Generalist for the Maghreb region (Part-time)
description:
HR Generalist for the Maghreb region (Part-time opportunity)

An HR Generalist with a global leader in the creation of Taste & Wellbeing and Fragrance & Beauty, and a key member of our regional HR Operations team supporting critical HR activities for our business and teams in the Maghreb region, and based in our Nouaceur office in Morocco -¬†Your future position?

Are you an experienced HR Specialist with at least 5 years of hands-on experience with core HR and employee life cycle activities, and would you like to take a new turn in your career by joining a global and leading organisation? Then this might be the perfect opportunity for you!

We are looking to expand our regional HR Operations team and hire an¬†‚ÄòHR Generalist‚Äô¬†for our HR Operations team in the Maghreb region. As an essential member of our local HR Operations team, you will support the business and teams in Morocco and Algeria for all HR-related topics throughout the employment life cycle from onboarding to exit. You will provide HR generalist support for - driving the employee life cycle, building solid relationships with line managers and employees, payroll processing, compliance, supporting HR activities and projects, and being a trusted advisor for all HR processes and programmes. ~25-30% of the role will be focused on providing HR Administration support.¬†

Based in our Nouaceur office in Morocco and reporting to the HR Manager for the Maghreb region, you will support our Fragrance & Beauty, Taste & Wellbeing, and Support Services teams. This will be a long-term part-time opportunity working roughly 5 half days a week from Monday-Friday. The role offers a great degree of flexibility, and excellent opportunities for personal and professional development.¬†

You will work for a company that touches billions of consumers more than a hundred times a day. With its heritage stretching back over 250 years, Givaudan has a long history of innovating scents and tastes. Our passion is to collaborate with customers and partners to develop game-changing innovations in the food & beverage, fragrance and beauty industries. We have a culture that works to inspire, challenge, and capture the heart and soul of consumers and customers. Our customers in the Maghreb region have local, regional, and international profiles, bringing diversity and curiosity to your daily job.

Sounds interesting? It could well be your perfect opportunity if you love staying ahead of the curve, delivering value, and are experienced at promoting solid relationships.

In this exciting role, with a 'can-do‚Äô mindset, you will be responsible for¬†-

HR Management support:

  • Help implement human resource strategies and programmes for Morocco and Algeria.¬†
  • Support the management and administration of all HR processes, including compensation & benefits, mobility, onboarding, training, performance management, and employee engagement programmes.
  • Independently manage the operational aspects of employee life cycle changes.¬†
  • Facilitate training and communication programs.
  • Provide relevant information, data and reports to support decision-making and policy and process improvements.
  • Participate in and help implement corporate and site initiatives and projects.

HR processes:

  • Support the development and roll-out of all HR services, processes, and systems across the countries in scope, in close collaboration with the Regional HR Centre of Excellence teams.¬†
  • Help promote employee feedback methods to improve HR services and processes.
  • Help define clear roles and responsibilities and streamline internal HR processes.
  • Support the proactive use of people management practices and systems and provide value-added reporting, enabling managers to make more helpful and fact-based decisions.

Payroll:

  • Manage all payroll activities for the countries in scope.
  • Help administer employee benefits for the countries in scope.
  • Prepare the payroll with high accuracy
  • Keep up to date with legal alterations and employment law changes.
  • Maintain leave and attendance records.¬†
  • Ensure new hires and data changes are entered into the HRIS and payroll systems.
  • Guide employees on payroll and benefits queries.¬†
  • Gather payroll data for inclusion in financial statements and prepare reports for management.

Employee Relations:

  • Guide managers and employees on employee relations matters, including performance management, career development, disciplinary actions, and organisational decisions.
  • Consult with the business on employee relations issues and ensure critical HR business processes like performance management, annual compensation reviews, learning and development, etc., are implemented.¬†¬†

Legal & Compliance:

  • Ensure organisational compliance with employment laws and help implement new legal requirements.
  • Provide interpretation and guidance on HR policies and employment laws.
  • Inform and advise managers and staff about relevant legislation, employee relations policies and practices.
  • Ensure organisational compliance on matters of occupational health in collaboration with EHS.

Talent Acquisition:

  • Ensure compliance with the talent acquisition process and best practices.
  • Manage the recruitment process end-to-end for only the scope job level roles from sourcing to shortlisting for selection and offer management.

Learning & Development:

  • Maintain the schedule of learning events so that the most current information is available to employees.
  • Send invites and logistics information to training participants ahead of time.
  • Book venues, arrange catering services, and secure internal/external trainers.
  • Be a point of contact and information for participants and trainers.
  • Manage attendance - prepare participant lists before training sessions and track participation afterwards.
  • Prepare regular training plan reports for the management.

Skills

You?¬†

Are you someone who wants to shape your own world? Who excels being in a culture where you can express yourself in a creative team environment? Who wants to collaborate and learn together with teams who are as passionate as you are? Then come join us ‚Äì and impact your world.

Your professional profile includes -¬†

  • Keen to only take on part-time roles for the near future.¬†
  • Bachelor or University degree in Human Resources, Psychology, Personnel/Labour Relations, or Law.
  • 5+ years of relevant and progressive hands-on work experience in an HR Generalist domain in international and multicultural work environments.
  • An understanding of the employment and legal landscape in Morocco and the wider region.
  • Working knowledge of ERPs like SuccessFactors is good to have.¬†
  • Excellent oral and written proficiency in the English and French languages.¬†
  • A good team player and comfortable with diversity.

Our benefits -¬†

  • Attractive compensation package with benefits.
  • Excellent opportunities for progressive learning and development.
  • A creative and purposeful team environment to inspire you.

description:
QUALIFICATIONS

  • Undergraduate/master's degree in software engineering, computer science, information technology or another related field degree OR student in his/her last year of studies
  • 1+ years of work experience/relevant internships in applied technology environments in designing, building and running projects with a clear record of achievements and proven drive for personal growth; international experience is a plus

WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH

You will be based in one of our offices in EMEA for ~10 weeks, usually in the summer, to work in teams and directly with our clients.
McKinsey Digital brings together the best of McKinsey‚Äôs digital capabilities to help our clients use digital technology to transform their businesses. In this role, you will help our clients in the private, public, and social sectors solve some of their most pressing problems. You will also work with a range of experts in the firm, from data scientists to researchers to software and app designers.
When you join McKinsey, you are joining a firm whose culture is distinctive and inclusive. Our office culture is casual, fun and social, with an emphasis on education and innovation. There is also a strong emphasis on mentoring others in the group, enabling them to grow and learn.

WHAT YOU'LL DO

You‚Äôll work in teams of typically 3-5 consultants, to identify, and oftentimes implement, potential solutions for a specific client problem or challenge. Together, you will help clients make lasting improvements to their performance and realize their most important goals.
McKinsey believes in strengths-based development and coaching, and you‚Äôll receive frequent mentoring from colleagues. This will include a senior colleague from your office or practice who will help you grow and achieve your career goals. Additionally, you will have a professional development manager who manages staffing to help you choose projects based on your priorities as well as the needs of client service teams.
Our internship program offers eligible undergraduate/graduate students first-hand experience with consulting at McKinsey Digital. At the end of your internship, you may receive an offer to join us as a full-time analyst after the completion of your degree.

title: Senior Sales Executive
description:
We are looking for someone to relocate to our headquarters in Qatar


Job Summary


You will be responsible for selling iHorizons' range of products and services to new and existing customers in various sectors and for managing the entire sales life cycle. You will also manage all the new accounts that you bring in with support from the Sales Operations Team.


Reporting Structure


This job reports to Sales Manager.


Job Objectives


‚Ä¢ Generate leads, convert them into opportunities, bid and successfully close the deals


‚Ä¢ Sell large and complex solutions to large organizations and achieve the assigned sales target


‚Ä¢ Manage the account forward for cross selling and upselling


Job Responsibilities


Sales Life Cycle Ownership


‚Ä¢ Generate new leads by focusing on hunting for new opportunities through existing professional networks, cold calling and leveraging on other methods to contact the decision makers


‚Ä¢ Be a trusted technology advisor to the target client to generate and qualify the right opportunities


‚Ä¢ Ensure the customer‚Äôs product requirements and expectations are managed and met by understanding the customer's business & technology


‚Ä¢ Work closely with the client in developing solutions, identifying the right technologies and in positioning iHorizons as the prime contender to win the deal


‚Ä¢ Own and manage the bidding process in collaboration with the bidding team and be responsible for the accuracy and quality of the end proposal and bid package till the signing of the deal


‚Ä¢ With a sales cycle, support senior management with market, account, competitor and bid intelligence information


‚Ä¢ Independently handle negotiations and deal closure for small and mid-sized deals


‚Ä¢ Provide the right inputs and support the Sales Manager in negotiating and closing large deals


Revenue Generation


‚Ä¢ Meet or exceed revenue targets by bringing in new customer logo‚Äôs and cross/upselling to existing or allocated accounts


‚Ä¢ Sell the range of iHorizons services assigned to the role holder


‚Ä¢ Ensure that revenues generated are at acceptable gross margins


Customer Relation Management / Account Management


‚Ä¢ Act as a single point of contact for the customer always


‚Ä¢ Carry out continuous market analysis and research on the dynamics of the account. Keep abreast of the developments from the client‚Äôs side as well as the market in which the client operates


‚Ä¢ Provide customized client-specific support during the three stages of client management: Bidding Cycle Management, Project Implementation, Recurring Service / after sales support


‚Ä¢ Work closely with the project team to maintain a continuous knowledge of project status for identifying potential issues and/or opportunities within the project


‚Ä¢ Be involved from the project kickoff meeting until final project sign-off; attend project meetings extensively and monitor customer satisfaction levels during implementation, take proactive measures to assure and maintain customer satisfaction


‚Ä¢ Drive account management and influence organizational engagement resulting in footprint expansion


‚Ä¢ Generate and maintain a credible forecast for accounts, share this information on a regular basis to management and suggest new lines of products/services relevant to clients/market


Upselling And Cross Selling


‚Ä¢ Prepare full account development plan to identify all customers business aspects in terms of revenue, requirements, opportunities, risk, etc. and maximize business opportunity


‚Ä¢ Identify and develop new leads from existing accounts


‚Ä¢ Increase the services offered to the customer. The role holder may be expected to increase the income generated by cross-sell and up-sell


‚Ä¢ Promote all iHorizons products/ services as they become available


‚Ä¢ Build trust and strengthen relationships by keeping customers informed on the way emerging technologies can help their business


‚Ä¢ Prepare briefings on the business, technical and financial benefits of technology and collaborate with customers to develop customized solutions.


General Account Administration


‚Ä¢ Support Sales Operations team to maintain and update the customer file for each client, which includes copies of contracts, proposals, letters, delivery notes, invoices etc.


‚Ä¢ Support Sales Operations team on contract renewals


‚Ä¢ Facilitate maintenance (reducing churn) of existing customers to ensure renewal of annuity contracts


‚Ä¢ Follow up on invoices and be responsible for payment collections


‚Ä¢ Have full understanding of all current and old contracts signed with the customer and complete knowledge of our services and cost structure


CRM and Reporting


‚Ä¢ Use iHorizons CRM to log and update all activities and generate sales reports


‚Ä¢ Provide other ad-hoc reports and analysis as required by the Sales Manager


Other Ongoing tasks


‚Ä¢ Visit major customers on regular basis, to strengthen relations and establish business opportunities


‚Ä¢ Entertain customers as and when necessary, to build strong relationships with them


‚Ä¢ Build relationships with the senior business and financial executives who influence purchasing decisions in customer companies


‚Ä¢ Maintain relationships with technical decision makers such as the Chief Information Officer, Information Technology Director, and Information Technology Manager on a day-to-day level


‚Ä¢ Coordinate with the Marketing Communications Coordinator on identifying and executing marketing opportunities


‚Ä¢ Participate in trade shows and technology events to promote company products and develop leads


Job Requirements


Educational Qualification


‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business Studies, Computer Sciences, or related field


‚Ä¢ Should show evidence of continued education in the field of Sales and Technology


Previous Work Experience


‚Ä¢ Minimum experience of 8 years, out of which the last 2-3 years should be in a similar role


‚Ä¢ Experience in customized enterprise IT solution sales is mandatory


‚Ä¢ Experience in sales within the ‚ÄúDigital Transformation‚Äù space is highly preferred


‚Ä¢ Sales experience in the Middle East and specifically in Qatar is highly preferred but not mandatory


‚Ä¢ Hands-on experience with CRM software is a plus


Skills and Abilities


‚Ä¢ Willing to relocate to Qatar is a must.


‚Ä¢ Excellent selling and negotiation skills


‚Ä¢ Ability to drive sales growth


‚Ä¢ Strong client focus and relationship-building skills


‚Ä¢ Excellent verbal and written communication skills


‚Ä¢ Excellent knowledge of MS Office


‚Ä¢ Excellent presentation skills


‚Ä¢ Self-motivated with a competitive, results-driven attitude


‚Ä¢ Good understanding of marketing and negotiating techniques


About iHorizons


iHorizons is a leading provider of business solutions and technology services in the Arab World. Headquartered in Doha, Qatar, we work with prominent clients to support their digital service migration journeys. The ultimate outcomes are radically improved customer experiences and increased operational efficiencies.


We are a forward-looking organization, always enhancing our methodologies and adopting new technologies so that we would serve our customers better and improve our position in the market. We have an outstanding culture, and we provide unique opportunities for career growth to all our staff.

The RGM Manager will lead the build-up of local RGM capability through the implementation of tools and frameworks.

title: Operation Planner
description:
Are you a recent graduate? We are seeking an operation planner to join our team.


The operations Planner is responsible to ensure a rigorous and efficient planning of vessel to enable the achievement of productivity targets.
The position is responsible for an efficient use of the Terminal Operating System using established standards and best practices.


Key of responsibilities:


  • Assume responsibility for the entire Cargo Control Process.
  • Process various vessel related EDIs and follow up on their timely submission as applicable
  • Ensure that the load-lists are finalized in time prior to the vessel ETA. Clarify issues with the shipping lines to mitigate disputes.
  • Interact closely with the shipping lines regarding additional changes after set cut-off time has passed.
  • Ensure close collaboration with the relevant counter parts at Liner Operations Cluster (LOC) and the Global Stowage Planners.
  • Investigate and document service failures, and report them to the appropriate parties.
  • Responsible for providing vessel and shipping agents with information about vessel load and discharge processes.
  • Maintain ownership of the vessels under your control during static planning Phase
  • Ensure efficient and highly productive planning as per established standard with due consideration to the vessel stability and safety under load and discharge.
  • Prepares and communicates vessel load plans and vessel work plans.
  • Preparation of vessel discharge and load sequence to support, achieve & sustain productivity targets per quay crane operation
  • Also maintain that all vessels receive paperwork in a timely manner.
  • Provide all loading documents, and quay crane working sequence to vessel prior or latest upon arrival.
  • Understand vessel stability and safety under discharge and load criteria and whether intended discharge and load plan meets those criteria
  • Maintain a continuous improvement mindset by actively seeking ways to reduce wastes in operations through a better planning
  • Constantly seek look for ways to improve own skills level in using the terminal operating system
  • Work hand in hand with other sections of the operations to achieve the terminal wide goals

Profile:


  • Master degree
  • Freshly graduated
  • Good communication in English and French

title: Sourcing Manager
description:
Have you ever wondered how imported goods from all corners of the world find their way to you? We have a customer-centric approach, and our business is transforming in a fast pace with focus on sustainability and digitalization. APM Terminals is an important link between Morocco and the world market.


The Sourcing role is part of the Tangier Procurement team, Your employment will be with APM Terminals Management Morocco, you will be reporting directly to Tangier entities Procurement manager who is based in Tangiers, Morocco.


You will be part of a truly global and professional Procurement function in a Fortune 500 company offering a dynamic environment with support and opportunities for individuals who have ambitions and take initiative.
This is a very varied role where you will build strong relationships with the internal customers, the management of the terminal as well as the global Procurement function


Key responsibilities:


You need to be able to understand both the commercial and the operational side of the terminals to become a trusted Procurement business partner and support in situations where we rely on external suppliers to keep the terminals running. Your key responsibilities will be to add value through:


  • Successfully matching our global strategies and priorities to local needs and opportunities.
  • Procurement of capital equipment and service following established procurement policies and procedures
  • Manages sourcing projects and works toward developing sourcing strategies and processes, Arrange tender procedures, receive bids, coordinate with demand owners to evaluate, assess and select the bidders based on capabilities and written criteria
  • Seek and partner with reliable vendors and suppliers; evaluate, assess and select vendors based on capabilities, performance and consistent quality assurance; keep accurate vendor report
  • Partner with stakeholders to ensure clear requirements documentation and assist the manager to plan further demands and order levels with the Requestors
  • Ensure compliance to global and local business principles, policies and standards and procurement policies whilst providing guidance to internal stakeholders on procurement principles and processes.
  • safeguarding the supplier related controls posture and ensure strong cost management though compliance to procurement processes and tools.
  • Identify risks and opportunities associated with purchases as well as potential changes, claims and market trends, according to purchasing policies and guidelines.
  • Identify savings and potential for improvement to ensure a better economic result for the company aligned with the objectives of the Procurement area.
  • Co-owning and executing the annual procurement plan to connect the terminals to best of breed supplier to optimize cost and enable innovation.

What we are looking for:


Ensure that every dollar spent is spent professionally. This is achieved by reducing operating expenses and driving a saving mindset by applying procurement capabilities and tools, to succeed in this role you :


  • Have customer Centricity mindset, an understanding of how customer needs relate to procurement activities.
  • Have strong interpersonal skill with the ability to partner with internal stakeholders.
  • Have a good understanding of strategic procurement and RFx processes. Ideally, also experience in contract implementation.
  • Understand the requisition-to-pay processes and the operational aspects of execution of them.
  • Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills, comfortable in engaging with a wide variety of stakeholders in an ambiguous environment with an agile mindset.
  • Have a structured working approach and analytical mindset together with a self-driven approach. Experience with LEAN is a plus.
  • Are able to work both independently, as well as and as part of a cross-departmental team.
  • Have strong planning, prioritizing skills and experience in managing procurement projects, process improvement, conducting supplier relationship management and supply chain/ contract management in a complex, fast-paced environment.
  • Are strong communicator both writing and speaking in business English, French and Arabic
  • Are Proficient in working with Microsoft Office Products including Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Word, Power BI.
  • Have a bachelor‚Äôs degree in engineering, logistics, supply chain management, business or similar, master degree is a plus. Procurement and contracting experience (minimum 6-8 years).
  • Experience with digital procurement tools will be an advantage

description:
Opportunity



You've seen us everywhere, from a road trip, passing over one of our trucks, to the biggest ports in the planet where we touch land to continue our journey All the Way to your front door. Now it's your chance to get to know us from within a workplace full of warmth, friendship, and support. You will get to focus on creating valuable relations with current and new customers and work with highly professional teams in an environment where you will be valued, recognized, and well rewarded.
You will work with amazing and diverse colleagues with a deep sense of commitment to live Our Values and together, go all the way for our customers, society and for each other.

Summary of the position:



Data stewards represent the Data Owner in business as usual (BAU) and project activities, they define the end-to-end data flow and guidelines to use data. They ensure that the critical data assets remain reliable and compliant within the enterprise, by connecting recognized best practices with functional strategic initiatives. Takes alignment with process and data owners to ensure APMT data ambitions are designed appropriately and incorporated respectively in the IFS architecture.
This data stewardship role will work closely within the respective Business Function and with the Data Governance& MDM organization, by leading, developing, and support the execution stewards and analysts. The Data Steward has overall accountability for the quality of the data asset that he/she is responsible for, managing, enabling multiple cross functional stake holders.
This role is responsible for executing APM Terminals‚Äô data governance processes to ensure fitness of data elements ‚Äì both content and metadata. This role ensures that sufficient data quality is maintained to enable use of data effectively to support Business processes.
Data stewards have a specialist role to assist Senior Data Stewards in their role to ensure Data Governance standards and policies are implemented and followed in APMT.

Key responsibilities:



Accountable for data quality with regards to the key/critical data elements existing within a specific data domain Accountable for master & reference data updating with the latest up-to-date information Provides inputs on the requirements of Enterprise Data Management processes related to the specific data domain
Monitors and supervises the complete lifecycle of the master & reference datasets Validates & approves the business terms & data definitions related to the data asset Makes decisions, independent and cross functional, for key Data and process change Engages in the ongoing and detailed evaluation of data quality, the identification of anomalies and discrepancies, and the contribution of expertise to understand the root cause and implement corrective measures
Engaged in day-to-day use of functional knowledge to gauge and approve/reject master & reference data creation/updating/deletion and solving functional issues related to the data Accountable for the SNOW forms related to Data and constantly working on format and process improvement Receives and updates global Data changes related to responsible area, in connection with Senior Data Stewards Ensures compliance and adherence to regional and global regulations Take part in Data Governance meetings to represent issues, clarifications & improvements related to the data domain that the data steward is responsible for Holds bandwidth to take decisions and lead multiple tasks in multiple locations Provide inputs and confirmations on global Dashboards in Maestro Regularly communicate Data changes and updates to terminal users
Is responsible for the data templates delivery for new implementations Is responsible for the execution of improvement projects/plan related to data
Drive maturity in the teams that are involved in the data execution process, ensure requestors and Data Execution teams are aware of the standards and guidelines that they must follow Provide training to users of the Data Requisition processes

We are looking for:



You have a relevant academic degree and solid experience You are detailed-orientated and likes to ensure that the work is done in the best way and in accordance with laws and regulations. You speak and write fluent English

Additional info



Ref. R78008 At APM Terminals, we are a team of over 20,000 employees spread across more than 60 countries united by a passion to provide our expertise in port operations and container management services. By providing the expertise and port infrastructure essential to world trade, we actively support the advancement of the societies around us, enabling local economies to unlock their potential and build an even stronger global community. Working with a team of talented professionals you will get a chance to experience different cultures and make friends all over the world. You‚Äôll find a culturally diverse, stimulating environment at any of our offices, terminals or depots. When you join APM Terminals, the world is your workplace. APM Terminals is an independent business unit within the Danish Maersk Group ‚Äì a Global Fortune 500 company with about 89,000 employees and offices in 130 countries with global growth opportunities in a range of fields from shipping and energy to our offshore and manufacturing industries - Join us to achieve even your most ambitious career goals!

Terms of Reference














The incumbent is responsible for supporting all activities related to Registration and RSD including administrative support to the Refugee Status Determination unit such as reception of asylum-seekers and refugees, scheduling of RSD appointments, support in handling the phone lines including hotlines and providing general information to asylum-seekers and refugees on assistance and services available, answering questions of asylum-seekers on the status of their RSD cases, and referring cases with protection emergencies to the relevant staff member/unit. S/he may also assist in counselling of asylum-seekers and assist in their registration process.
The incumbent may also support in the daily management of the filing unit, recording all file movements on the tracking system and making sure that all files are adequately stored.Standard Job DescriptionSenior Protection Assistant Organizational Setting and Work Relationships
The Senior Protection Assistant normally reports to a more senior Protection colleague. The incumbent monitors protection standards, operational procedures and practices in protection delivery in line with international standards and provides functional protection support to information management and programme staff. The Senior Protection Assistant provides quality, timely and effective protection support to persons of concern (PoC) and identifies opportunities to mainstream protection methodologies and safeguards in operational responses. S/he contributes to designing a comprehensive protection strategy and may liaise externally with local authorities and partners on protection issues as guided by the supervisor. The Senior Protection Assistant also ensures that PoC are involved in making decisions that affect them, whether in accessing their rights or in identifying appropriate solutions to their problems. To achieve this, the incumbent will need to build and maintain effective interfaces with communities of concern, local authorities and protection and assistance partners. All UNHCR staff members are accountable to perform their duties as reflected in their job description. They do so within their delegated authorities, in line with the regulatory framework of UNHCR which includes the UN Charter, UN Staff Regulations and Rules, UNHCR Policies and Administrative Instructions as well as relevant accountability frameworks. In addition, staff members are required to discharge their responsibilities in a manner consistent with the core, functional, cross-functional and managerial competencies and UNHCR's core values of professionalism, integrity and respect for diversity. Duties
- Consistently apply International and National Law and applicable UN/UNHCR and IASC policy, standards and codes of conduct. - Provide counselling on protection issues to PoC; liaise with competent authorities to ensure the issuance of personal and other relevant documentation. - Support activities in protection related AGD based programming with implementing and operational partners.
- Conduct preliminary information gathering and interviews in support of eligibility, status determination, durable solutions and social needs assessment.
- Contribute to measures to identify, prevent and reduce statelessness.
- Contribute to a country-level child protection plan as part of the protection strategy.
- Contribute to a country-level education plan for PoC as part of the protection strategy. - Monitor Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for all protection/solutions activities.
- Participate in individual protection case management including cases of GBV and child protection. Monitor and report on cases of refoulement, expulsion and other protection incidents.
- Assist in identifying durable solutions for PoC in voluntary repatriation, local integration and where appropriate, resettlement.
- Contribute to the design, implementation and evaluation of protection related AGD based programming with implementing and operational partners.
- Draft reports, routine correspondence, update relevant databases and compiling statistics within the Area of Responsibility (AoR). - Contribute to initiatives to enhance national and local protection capacities.
- Select PoC for preliminary interviews and decide which relevant information to share.
- Enforce integrity in the delivery of protection services by local implementing partners.
- Perform other related duties as required. Minimum Qualifications
